issue.title: liboqs on Ubuntu 20
issue.body:
Hi all,

I tried liboqs, but fail. 


project@project:~/liboqs/build$ cmake -GNinja ..
-- The C compiler identification is GNU 9.3.0
-- The ASM compiler identification is GNU
-- Found assembler: /usr/bin/cc
-- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc
-- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc -- works
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
-- Detecting C compile features
-- Detecting C compile features - done
CMake Error at .CMake/gcc_clang_intrinsics.cmake:9 (message):
  Could not compile .CMake/detect_gcc_clang_intrinsics.cChange Dir:
  /home/project/liboqs/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp

  

  Run Build Command(s):/usr/bin/ninja cmTC_f6544 && [1/2] Building C object
  CMakeFiles/cmTC_f6544.dir/detect_gcc_clang_intrinsics.c.o

  FAILED: CMakeFiles/cmTC_f6544.dir/detect_gcc_clang_intrinsics.c.o

  /usr/bin/cc -fPIE -march=native -o
  CMakeFiles/cmTC_f6544.dir/detect_gcc_clang_intrinsics.c.o -c
  /home/project/liboqs/.CMake/detect_gcc_clang_intrinsics.c

  cc1: error: bad value (‘tigerlake’) for ‘-march=’ switch

  cc1: note: valid arguments to ‘-march=’ switch are: nocona core2
  nehalem corei7 westmere sandybridge corei7-avx ivybridge core-avx-i haswell
  core-avx2 broadwell skylake skylake-avx512 cannonlake icelake-client
  icelake-server cascadelake bonnell atom silvermont slm goldmont
  goldmont-plus tremont knl knm x86-64 eden-x2 nano nano-1000 nano-2000
  nano-3000 nano-x2 eden-x4 nano-x4 k8 k8-sse3 opteron opteron-sse3 athlon64
  athlon64-sse3 athlon-fx amdfam10 barcelona bdver1 bdver2 bdver3 bdver4
  znver1 znver2 btver1 btver2 native

  cc1: error: bad value (‘tigerlake’) for ‘-mtune=’ switch

  cc1: note: valid arguments to ‘-mtune=’ switch are: nocona core2
  nehalem corei7 westmere sandybridge corei7-avx ivybridge core-avx-i haswell
  core-avx2 broadwell skylake skylake-avx512 cannonlake icelake-client
  icelake-server cascadelake bonnell atom silvermont slm goldmont
  goldmont-plus tremont knl knm intel x86-64 eden-x2 nano nano-1000 nano-2000
  nano-3000 nano-x2 eden-x4 nano-x4 k8 k8-sse3 opteron opteron-sse3 athlon64
  athlon64-sse3 athlon-fx amdfam10 barcelona bdver1 bdver2 bdver3 bdver4
  znver1 znver2 btver1 btver2 generic native

  ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.

  

Call Stack (most recent call first):
  .CMake/compiler_opts.cmake:49 (include)
  CMakeLists.txt:89 (include)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/home/project/liboqs/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".


Ubuntu version and GCC version:
ubuntu1~20.04
gcc version 9.3.0 

Thank you,

comment.body:
I got an error. 

project@project:~/liboqs/build$ cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang ..
CMake Error at .CMake/gcc_clang_intrinsics.cmake:9 (message):
  Could not compile .CMake/detect_gcc_clang_intrinsics.cChange Dir:
  /home/project/liboqs/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp

  

  Run Build Command(s):/usr/bin/ninja cmTC_59afc && [1/2] Building C object

  /home/project/liboqs/.CMake/detect_gcc_clang_intrinsics.c

  cc1: note: valid arguments to ‘-march=’ switch are: nocona core2

  core-avx2 broadwell skylake skylake-avx512 cannonlake icelake-client
  icelake-server cascadelake bonnell atom silvermont slm goldmont

  athlon64-sse3 athlon-fx amdfam10 barcelona bdver1 bdver2 bdver3 bdver4
  znver1 znver2 btver1 btver2 native

  cc1: note: valid arguments to ‘-mtune=’ switch are: nocona core2

comment.body: The last run still seems to use cc1 and not clang. You may want to clear the `build` folder completely and _then_ run the command suggested by @jschanck in that clean setup.

comment.body: @jschanck  Thank you for helpful comment. Your solution solves the issue.

@levitte Suggestion sought for getting at passphrase, e.g., [here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/blob/b3d609aea39fba1c20b95729f23db89d391b56aa/oqsprov/oqs_encode_key2any.c#L129). Thoughts on the issue above also very welcome.
Also, the `get_passphrase` wrapper can be modified to simply call whatever passphrase reader you want to use.  There's nothing obligating you to call the one passed (ultimately from the application).

issue.title: Endianness issues with FrodoKEM-SHAKE and BIKE
issue.body:
When building liboqs on s390x (#1100), everything builds and tests pass, except the KAT for FrodoKEM-SHAKE and BIKE. The most plausible cause to me are endianness issues (s390x is a big-endian architecture).
I open the issue here because Frodo and BIKE are direct contributions to liboqs.

See the build log:
https://app.travis-ci.com/github/bhess/liboqs/jobs/541322083

Frodo seems to already have macros defined to support big-endian and the -AES versions pass the tests.
Looking at the code, I think the way `a_cols` is accessed here could be problematic:
https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/36d8a49c886d6b2e58f8b3b0e06d0920eeea5b6d/src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo_macrify_shake_portable.c#L42

BIKE seems to be explicit about it that the code only supports little-endian:
https://github.com/awslabs/bike-kem/blob/master/cmake/arch.cmake
It could therefore be best to just disable it in big-endian builds for now.

comment.body:
> It could therefore be best to just disable it in big-endian builds for now.

Explicitly tagging @dkostic for an opinion on this.

issue.title: Migrate X.509 to composite keys and sigs drafts

comment.body: Good point re: trying in a separate branch for now. I didn't think too careful about the choice of word "migrate"; I'll change it to "Add".
